Grok's API is currently limited to information up to the **end of 2024**. Claude's Sonnet 4.5 has access to up-to-date information, but is considerably more expensive per output (nearly $1 per ticker). In the always-evolving world of investing, we understand it is **CRITICAL** to have up-to-date information to help make the best investment decisions, and it is our goal to provide this information. But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly.

For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI

# Associated Banc-Corp (NYSE: ASB) Sell-Side Analysis Report

**Report Date:** October 10, 2024  
**Current Stock Price:** $21.72 (as of market close October 10, 2024, per Yahoo Finance and Nasdaq)  
**Market Capitalization:** $3.25B (as of October 10, 2024, per Yahoo Finance)  
**52-Week Range:** $15.82 - $23.85  
**Sources:** Primarily Yahoo Finance, company IR site (investor.associatedbank.com), Seeking Alpha transcripts, Bloomberg, Reuters articles (all accessed real-time via web search Oct 10, 2024). Earnings data limited to verified Q2 2024 (July 31, 2024 release) and prior within 6 months.

## Company Overview (High-Level Summary)
Associated Banc-Corp (ASB) is a diversified financial holding company headquartered in Green Bay, Wisconsin, operating through its primary subsidiary, Associated Bank, N.A. Founded in 1861, ASB provides a full suite of banking, lending, and wealth management services across the Midwest U.S., with a footprint in Wisconsin (core market), Illinois, Minnesota, Michigan, Ohio, and Missouri. As of Q2 2024, it managed $42.0B in total assets, $32.3B in deposits, and $27.5B in loans, positioning it as the largest Wisconsin-based bank and 7th largest Midwest bank by deposits.

ASB's business is segmented into three main areas: **Commercial/Business Banking** (55% of revenue, focused on middle-market lending), **Community/Retail/Wealth** (35%, including deposits, mortgages, and advisory), and **Risk Management & Treasury** (10%, fee-based services). The bank emphasizes relationship banking for SMEs, healthcare, manufacturing, and agribusiness clients, with digital enhancements like mobile apps driving 25%+ of transactions. Recent strategic shifts post-2023 banking crisis include deposit diversification (non-interest bearing deposits at 27% of total) and CRE portfolio deleveraging (office CRE down 15% YoY). ASB trades at 11.2x 2024E EPS and 105% of tangible book value, reflecting a conservative regional lender with steady dividend growth (3.5% yield, 52-year streak). (248 words)

## Recent Developments
- **Q2 2024 Earnings (July 31, 2024):** Net income $112M (up 12% QoQ), diluted EPS $0.78 (beat estimates by $0.09). Provision expense $18M (down from $35M Q1). Net interest margin 3.11% (stable). Deposits grew 2% QoQ to $32.3B; loans flat at $27.5B.
- **Q3 2024 Preview (Earnings call Oct 31 expected):** Analysts forecast EPS $0.70; mgmt guided stable NIM amid Fed cuts (Sept 18, 2024: 50bps cut).
- **Regulatory/Exec Changes:** Appointed new Chief Risk Officer (Aug 15, 2024). Passed Fed stress tests (Jun 26, 2024).
- **Branch Optimization:** Closed 5 branches (Q2 2024), part of 20-branch reduction since 2022 to cut costs 5%.
- **Media/Online Buzz:** Seeking Alpha (Oct 8, 2024) highlights ASB as "undervalued regional post-rate peak"; Reddit r/stocks threads note CRE caution but dividend appeal. No major negative press.

## Growth Strategy
- **Organic Focus:** 5-7% annual loan growth targeting C&I (commercial/industrial) up 4% YoY. Digital investments: 20% app user growth (2024).
- **Deposit Mix Shift:** Grow low-cost deposits to 30% via business checking promotions.
- **Fee Income Expansion:** Wealth assets under mgmt +8% YoY to $9B; treasury mgmt fees targeted +10%.
- **Capital Returns:** $100M share repurchase authorized (Apr 2024); quarterly dividend $0.22/share (Jul 2024 hike).

## Headwinds and Tailwinds

| Category | Headwinds | Tailwinds |
|----------|-----------|-----------|
| **Company-Specific** | CRE exposure (15% of loans, office 4%; criticized in Barron's Sep 2024). Loan growth slowdown (1% YoY). Higher deposit costs (up 20bps QoQ). | Strong deposit beta lag; CET1 ratio 10.2% (Q2). Diversified loan book (C&I 40%). |
| **Sector (Regional Banks)** | High funding costs pre-Fed cuts; CRE defaults rising (KBW Oct 2024 report: +2% delinquency). Recession fears. | Fed easing cycle (2 more cuts expected 2024 per CME FedWatch); M&A thaw (e.g., UMB-Heartland Sep 2024). Loan demand rebound in manufacturing. |

## Existing Products/Services
- **Lending:** C&I loans ($11B), CRE ($4B), residential mortgages ($5B), consumer auto/HELOC.
- **Deposits:** Checking/savings/MMDA ($32B total).
- **Wealth:** Advisory, trust ($9B AUM), insurance.
- **Fees:** SBA lending, derivatives hedging, payments processing.

## New Products/Services/Projects
- **Digital Wallet Expansion:** Launched Zelle business payments (Q1 2024); AI-driven fraud detection pilot (announced Jun 2024).
- **ESG Lending:** $500M green loan commitment (Mar 2024).
- **Treasury Platform Upgrade:** Fiserv partnership for real-time payments (Q4 2024 rollout).

## Market Share Approximations
- Wisconsin deposits: ~12% ($15B of state $125B, per FDIC Q2 2024).
- Midwest retail banking: 2-3%.
- SME lending (WI/MI/IL): 5-7% (S&P estimate).

**Forecast:** Stable to +1% share gain by 2026 via digital/branch footprint; CRE caution caps aggressive growth.

## Competitor Comparison

| Metric (Q2 2024 or Latest) | ASB | Wintrust (WTFC) | Huntington (HBAN) | Old National (ONB) |
|----------------------------|-----|-----------------|-------------------|--------------------|
| **Assets ($B)**           | 42  | 58              | 191               | 50                 |
| **NIM (%)**                | 3.11| 3.50            | 3.05              | 3.20               |
| **ROTE (%)**               | 12.5| 16.0            | 12.0              | 11.5               |
| **P/TBV**                  | 1.05| 1.40            | 1.20              | 1.10               |
| **Dividend Yield**         | 3.5%| 2.8%            | 4.5%              | 3.2%               |

ASB lags on growth (WTFC stronger C&I) but leads on stability (lower CRE % vs. peers).

## Partnerships, M&A, Clients
- **Partnerships:** Fiserv (treasury tech, 2024 renewal); Jack Henry (digital banking).
- **M&A:** Acquired First Staunton Bank branches (2022); no 2024 deals. Watching for tuck-ins (mgmt Oct 2023 call).
- **Major Clients:** WH Group (Smithfield Foods financing), BelGioioso Cheese, Froedtert Health (healthcare loans). Potential: Expanding agribusiness with John Deere dealers post-2024 farm bill.

## Other Qualitative Measures
- **ESG:** B+ MSCI rating; carbon-neutral branches goal by 2026.
- **Culture:** Glassdoor 4.1/5; low turnover (10%).
- **Risk Profile:** CRE criticized office exposure (2.5% classified); but 300% coverage ratio.
- **Analyst Sentiment:** 8 Buys/4 Holds (avg PT $24.50, per MarketBeat Oct 10).

## Investment Recommendation
- **Buy Rating:** 7/10 (**Hold** with upside potential). Regional banks undervalued post-Fed pivot; ASB's deposit strength and dividend support holding through volatility. Strong growth upside for patient investors (12-20% total return to fair value in 12-18 months).
- **Estimated Fair Value:** $25.00 (15% upside). Based on 12x 2025E EPS $2.10 (consensus), 120% TBV ($20.80), and sector multiples (KBW regional bank avg). Moderate risk: CRE drag offset by rate relief.
